text: How do you think the Grammys have progressed in how they treat black music, and especially hip - hop? A rapper hasn ’ t won album of the year since Outkast in 2004. The only way I can view that is as a challenge. Outkast — the combination of rock and funk and blues and all kind of musicality within their hip - hop — they overcame the language barrier. We ’ re talking about voters who may not know anything about hip - hop. If you stay focused on what you do, you overpower that. That ’ s what Jay - Z represents to me.
